item.text: Samson went down to Timnah, where a Philistine girl caught his eye.

When he <st data-num="05927" class="">got home</st>,<n id="1" /> he <st data-num="05046 0559">told</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> and <st data-num="0517" class="">mother</st>, “A <st data-num="01323 06430">Philistine</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">girl</st> in <st data-num="08553" class="">Timnah</st> has <st data-num="07200" class="">caught</st> my <st data-num="07200" class="">eye</st>.<n id="2" /> <st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">get</st> her for my <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st>.”

But his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> and <st data-num="0517" class="">mother</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “<st data-num="0369" class="">Certainly</st> you can find a <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> among your <st data-num="01323 0251">relatives</st> or among <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> our<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>! <st data-num="0859" class="">You</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">should</st> not have to <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> and <st data-num="03947" class="">get</st> a <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> from the <st data-num="06189" class="">uncircumcised</st> <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st>.”<n id="2" /> But <st data-num="08123" class="">Samson</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st>, “<st data-num="03947" class="">Get</st> her for me<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">she</st> <st data-num="03474" class="">is</st> the <st data-num="03474" class="">right</st> one for <st data-num="05869" class="">me</st>.”<n id="4" />

Now his father and mother did not realize this was the Lord’s doing because he was looking for an opportunity to stir up trouble with the Philistines (for at that time the Philistines were ruling Israel).
Samson went down to Timnah. When he approached the vineyards of Timnah, he saw a roaring young lion attacking him.
The Lord’s Spirit empowered him, and he tore the lion in two with his bare hands as easily as one would tear a young goat. But he did not tell his father or mother what he had done.
Samson continued on down to Timnah and spoke to the girl. In his opinion, she was just the right one.

<st data-num="03117" class="">Sometime</st> later, when he <st data-num="07725" class="">went back</st> to <st data-num="03947" class="">marry</st><n id="1" /> her, he <st data-num="05493" class="">turned aside</st> to <st data-num="07200" class="">see</st> the <st data-num="0738" class="">lion’s</st> <st data-num="04658" class="">remains</st>. He <st data-num="02009" class="">saw</st><n id="2" /> a <st data-num="05712" class="">swarm</st> of <st data-num="01682" class="">bees</st> in the <st data-num="0738" class="">lion’s</st> <st data-num="01472" class="">carcass</st>, as well as some <st data-num="01706" class="">honey</st>.

He scooped it up with his hands and ate it as he walked along. When he returned to his father and mother, he offered them some and they ate it. But he did not tell them he had scooped the honey out of the lion’s carcass.
Then Samson’s father accompanied him to Timnah for the marriage. Samson hosted a party there, for this was customary for bridegrooms to do.

<st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> the Philistines <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> he had no attendants, they <st data-num="03947" class="">gave</st> him <st data-num="07970" class="">30</st> <st data-num="04828" class="">groomsmen</st> who <st data-num="01961" class="">kept</st> him <st data-num="0854" class="">company</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="08123" class="">Samson</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to them, “I will <st data-num="02330 04994">give</st> you a <st data-num="02420" class="">riddle</st>. <st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> you <st data-num="05046" class="">really</st> can <st data-num="05046 04672">solve</st> it during the <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> the <st data-num="04960" class="">party</st> lasts,<n id="1" /> I will <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> you <st data-num="07970" class="">30</st> <st data-num="05466" class="">linen robes</st> and <st data-num="07970" class="">30</st> <st data-num="02487" class="">sets</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st>.

But <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> you <st data-num="03808 03201">cannot</st> <st data-num="05046" class="">solve</st> it,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> will <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> me <st data-num="07970" class="">30</st> <st data-num="05466" class="">linen robes</st> and <st data-num="07970" class="">30</st> <st data-num="02487" class="">sets</st> of <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st>.” They <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “Let us <st data-num="08085" class="">hear</st> your <st data-num="02330 02420">riddle</st>.”<n id="2" />

He said to them,

“Out of the one who eats came something to eat;

out of the strong one came something sweet.”

They could not solve the riddle for three days.

On the fourth day they said to Samson’s bride, “Trick your husband into giving the solution to the riddle. If you refuse, we will burn up you and your father’s family. Did you invite us here to make us poor?”

So <st data-num="08123" class="">Samson’s</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">bride</st> <st data-num="01058" class="">cried</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his shoulder<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “You <st data-num="07535" class="">must</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="08130" class="">hate</st> me; you do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0157" class="">love</st> me! You <st data-num="02330" class="">told</st> the <st data-num="01121" class="">young</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">men</st><n id="3" /> a <st data-num="02420" class="">riddle</st>, but you have <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05046" class="">told</st> me <st data-num="05046" class="">the solution</st>.” He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to her, “<st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st>, I have <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> even <st data-num="05046" class="">told</st> my <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> or <st data-num="0517" class="">mother</st>. Do you really expect me to <st data-num="05046" class="">tell</st> you?”<n id="4" />

She <st data-num="01058" class="">cried</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his shoulder<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07651 03117 0834">until</st> the <st data-num="04960" class="">party</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> almost over.<n id="2" /> <st data-num="01961" class="">Finally</st>, on the <st data-num="07637" class="">seventh</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>, he <st data-num="05046" class="">told</st> her <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> she had <st data-num="06693" class="">nagged</st> him so much.<n id="3" /> Then she <st data-num="05046" class="">told</st> the <st data-num="01121" class="">young</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">men</st> <st data-num="05046" class="">the solution to</st> the <st data-num="02420" class="">riddle</st>.<n id="4" />

On the seventh day, before the sun set, the men of the city said to him,

“What is sweeter than honey?

What is stronger than a lion?”

He said to them,

“If you had not plowed with my heifer,

you would not have solved my riddle!”
The Lord’s Spirit empowered him. He went down to Ashkelon and killed 30 men. He took their clothes and gave them to the men who had solved the riddle. He was furious as he went back home.
Samson’s bride was then given to his best man.
